bwwExcerpt: 'Present Laughter" is NoÃ«l Coward's funniest and most perfectly wrought comedy, give or take "Blithe Spirit." But unlike "Blithe Spirit," which all but plays itself, "Present Laughter" won't come off unless the central character, a monstrously vain actor-playwright-celebrity who behaves in a manner all but indistinguishable from Coward himself, is portrayed by an actor who oozes star quality from every orifice and is also naturally funny.
